definitions.definition: smallest in size, amount, degree, etc.

examples.text: He's the best teacher, even though he has the least experience.
She never had the least idea what to do about it.
He gave (the) least of all towards the wedding present.
How others see me is the least of my worries *(= I have more important things to worry about)*.
It's **the least I can do** to help *(= I feel I should do more)*.

definitions.definition: used after amounts to show that the amount is the lowest possible

examples.text: It'll take a year, at the very least.
Really, I'm not in the least tired.
‘Do you mind if I put the television on?’ ‘No, not in the least.’
Normally I'm not the least bit shy.
He wasn't the slightest bit interested in answering our questions.

definitions.definition: without making something seem better, worse, more serious, etc. than it really is

examples.text: I was surprised, to say the least.

wordOrigin: Old English lǣst, lǣsest, of Germanic origin; related to less.
